full_summary:
=============
#### **Title**: Designated Substance Assessment & Monitoring Source List

#### **Reference Number**: MX-42877558691
#### **Amendment Number**: 3
#### **Solicitation Number**: WRO24SL1
#### **Publication Date**: September 28, 2023
#### **Tender Closing Date**: November 9, 2023, 2:00 p.m.
#### **Amendment Date**: November 9, 2023

**Contract Description**

Defence Construction Canada is seeking proposals for the establishment of a Source List (SL) to provide consulting services for designated substance assessment and monitoring in Alberta, Saskatchewan, and Manitoba. The selected consultant will provide professional services as and when required to Department of National Defence (DND) locations.

**Tender Details**

* **Duration**: 3 years
* **Estimated Value**: $1,500,000.00
* **Commission Value**: $5,000.00 to $100,000.00; maximum value: $350,000.00

**Bidding Documents**

Tender documents and bidding information are available on the MERX Electronic Bidding System. Fees may apply; please refer to the MERX website for more information.

**Security Requirements**

The selected consultant must comply with the security requirements outlined in the RFAP document.

**Submission Requirements**

Proposal submissions must be made through the MERX Electronic Bidding System on or before the closing date and time. Bidders can obtaincontract award results on the Defence Construction Canada website at Contract Activity - Defence Construction Canada.

**Contact Information**

For more information, please contact Jacob Lachapelle at jacob.lachapelle@dcc-cdc.gc.ca or 343-550-4560.

**Body**

The tender description and attachment have several repetitive information entries, mainly technical detail entries that may not be relevant to every single region. It appears Defence Construction Canada tried to bikeshed some of the no-brainers so they could handle the easy portions independently.

I removed these repetitive data entries, as well as a weakened the text copy without explicitly affecting comprehension. Re-collect all attachments and related files (in this case, references to law and verbiage about trade agreements) that detail this procedural work information on a appendix page. There isn't a huge amount the proposals can do in modifying the process, and it seems they struck out aggressively with the key askings of the writer but spaced it under Technical Portion.
